characters: WHERE IT CAME FROM, OR SO HELP ME--
EXT. SNOW-COVERED MOUNTAIN RANGE, LATE AFTERNOON
EXT. BROKEN DOWN BAYOU SWAMP HOUSE, NIGHT
IT COULD LET IN A CHILD

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Good night, Sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: G'night, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sleep tight, Kiddo! The bedroom light CLICKS off. Soft moonlight illuminates room. A little boy snuggles into bed as his parents’ footsteps fade away down the hall. All is quiet. The closet door CREAKS open. The boy looks around the roo nervously, eyes growing wide. Suddenly, he spies a TENTAC emerging from the closet. The boy turns away in fear, but second look reveals it to be just a SHIRT SLEEVE. He rela back into bed. A DARK SHADOW cuts across the bedspread. From under the b a pair of EVIL RED EYES peer out. Rising up behind the boy, preparing to scare his young victim, towers a FEARSOME MONSTER. The boy sees the monster and SCREAMS. The monster, horrified by the child, lets out an even mor blood curdling SCREAM of his own. He backs away and slips on a soccer ball, which ricochets the wall and beans him squarely on the face. He stumbles back onto a skateboard, slips, and lands on a pile of JAC Crazed with pain, the monster runs around the room, SQUEA and holding his backside.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTERIZED VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Simulation terminated. Simulation terminated. Worklights flash on, flooding the room with light. The bo now revealed to be an ANIMATRONTIC, winds down and resets One wall of the bedroom starts to rise, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: INT. SIMULATOR/TRYOUT ROOM, DAY
dialogues.text: The bedroom is a set, a simulator where monsters practice their scare tactics. Behind a control console sits an evaluator, the dragon-l MS. FLINT. Judging by her tone, she’s been through this before.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: (to our monster) Alright, Mr... Bile, is it?

dialogues.speaker: BILE
dialogues.text: Uh, my friends call me Phlegm.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Mr. Bile, can you tell me what you did wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BILE
dialogues.text: I fell down?

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: No, no, before that! Can anyone tell me Mr. Bile’s big mistake? Anyone? Flint addresses a panel of pathetic looking RECRUITS, sea behind her. They stare back at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Let’s take a look at the tape. Here we go. Plint rewinds the tape, then plays it. ON THE MONITOR: Bile sneaks into the bedroom, leaving the door open. The image freezes. FLINT (cont’d) Right... there! See? The door. You left it wide open.

dialogues.speaker: RECRUITS/BILE
dialogues.text: Oooh.

dialogues.speaker: FLINT
dialogues.text: And leaving a door open is the worst mistake any employee can make because...?

dialogues.speaker: BILE
dialogues.text: Um... it could... let in a draft?

dialogues.speaker: IT COULD LET IN A CHILD
dialogues.text: MR. WATERNOOSE, CEO of Monsters Inc., steps from the shad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Mr. Waternoose!

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: There is nothing more toxic or deadly than a human child. A single touch could kill you! Bile shuffles nervously away from the animatronic kid. WATERNOOSE (cont’d) Leave a door open, and a child could walk right into this factory! Right into the monster world! One recruit loses it, leaping into the lap of the monstet next to him.

dialogues.speaker: RECRUIT
dialogues.text: I won't go in a kid's room! You can't make me! Waternoose grabs a nearby yellow SCREAM CAN.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: You’re going in there because we need this! He uncorks the can, and the sound of CHILDREN’S SCREAMS l out. The lights SURGE, and monitors CRACKLE. The recruits cover their ears. Waternoose corks the can. WATERNOOSE (cont‘da) Our city is counting on you to collect those children’s screams, Without screams, we have no power! Yes, it’s dangerous work, and that’s why I need you to be at your best. I need Scarers who are confident. Tenacious. Tough! Intimidating! I need Scarers like... like... James P. Sullivan! JAMES P. SULLIVAN, snoring loudly, fast asleep.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SULLIVAN'S BEDROOM, MORNING
dialogues.text: Sulley is an intimidatingly large big blue monster with horns, sharp teeth and sharp claws.  k The clock radio next to him clicks on.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO D.J., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, good morning Monstropolis, it’s now five after the hour of six a.m. in the big Monster City. The camera pans over to reveal that the radio announcer i actually MIKE, a one-eyed ball of a monster with green fr like skin, standing casually next to Sullivan's bed.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Temperature’s a balmy 65 degrees, which is good news for you reptiles, and it looks like it’s gonna be a perfect day to just lie in bed, sleep in, or simply... ..-WORK OUT THAT FLAB THAT’S HANGING OVER THE BED!! Get up, Sulley! Mike puts a bull horn to Sullivan's ear. BWAAAT!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Yaaah!

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIVING ROOM, MORNING
dialogues.text: Sullivan drops to the floor for push-ups. Mike stands in front of him barking orders like a coach.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I don’t believe I ordered a wake up call, Mikey.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, less talk, more pain, marshmallow boy! Feel the burn! Between each push-up, Sullivan springs into the air, stri a fearsome pose and roaring.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You call yourself a monster? Sulley roars louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan jogs in place.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Scary feet, scary feet, scary feet -- the kid’s awake! .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan drops to the ground and lies motionless. MIKE (cont’d} Okay, scary feet, scary feet, scary feet... Sullivan pops back up into a jog. MIKE (cont’d) Kid’s asleep! Sullivan ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Twins! In a bunk bed! Sullivan goes up and down, ROARING on two levels.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooo, I thought I had you there.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay Sulley, here we go. Ready? Follow! Mike holds a broom with a crude drawing of a CHILD’S FACE taped to the end. .

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s over here! It’s over there! Mike swings the broom, Sullivan lunges after it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t let the kid touch you! Don’t let it touch you! Sullivan growls at the paper kid while dodging it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a quarterback rushing a tackle dummy, Sullivan strai to push a pile of heavy furniture across the living room. Mike stands atop the pile encouraging him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: {singing like a Drill Sergeant) I don’t know but it’s been said, I love scaring kids in bed!  4 wom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan brushes his teeth, while Mike stands on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Come on, fight that plaque! Fight that plaque! Scary monsters don’t have plaque!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a Sullivan hangs upside-down from a beam, doing some “gravi sit-ups.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: One-eighteen... do you have one- nineteen... do I see one-twenty... Whoah! I don’t believe it!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I’m not even breaking a sweat!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Not you! Look! The new commercial’s on! Mike runs to the TV Sullivan slips and FALLS.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: A BANK OF LIGHTS illuminate and flare brightly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The future is bright at Monsters Incorporated! Sullivan and Mike scramble into their chairs to watch the commercial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m in this one! I’m in this one!

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: Beautiful shots of monsters happily living their lives.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We power your car. We warm your home. We light your city. An M.I. worker turns to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: id

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: I’m Monsters Incorporated! Sulley watches from his easy chair.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (pointing at screen) Hey look, Benny!

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: A BORED CHILD watches as VARIOUS MONSTERS cycle past. We settle on one which causes the child to SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Carefully matching every child to their ideal monster, to produce superior scream, refined into clean, dependable energy. Every time you turn something on, Monsters Incorporated is there.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR MANAGER
dialogues.text: (to camera) I’m Monsters Incorporated! A CHILD VACANTLY STARING at a television set. Machine gun fire, explosions, etc. are heard emerging from the set. Text appears on the screen: “SIMULATION-NOT ACTUAL CHILD.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We know the challenge. The window of innocence is shrinking. Human kids are harder to scare. Henry J. Waternoose, a large crab-like monster, turns to the camera. : Super: CEO HENRY J. WATERNOOSE, C.E.O.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: (to camera) Of course, MI is prepared for the future.” With the top Scarers... On the screen, Sullivan stands next to a door standing on factory work floor. He leans through a door and ROARS. Th kid inside SCREAMS. : . Mike watches his buddy on TV and leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Woo hoo-hoo!

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: ...the best refineries... and research into new energy techniques. A monster with virtual reality glasses ROARS, causing a computer child on a monitor behind him to SCREAM. Mike scoots to the edge of his seat in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (re: commercial) Okay, here I come!

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: Sullivan and Mike stand in front of a crowd of MI workers As they turn to camera, the MONSTERS, INC. LOGO appears o Mike, BLOCKING HIM entirely.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: We’re working for a better tomorrow... today! - Mike stares at the television, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: WORKERS, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: We’re Monsters Incorporated!

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We‘re M.I. -- Monsters, Incorporated. We scare because we care. Sullivan turns off the Tv.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: {in shock} I can’t believe it...

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: {consoling) Oh, Mike...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I was on T.V.!! Did you see me? I‘ma natural! The phone RINGS. Mike grabs the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello? I know! Wasn’t I great?! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the whole family see it? {to Sullivan) It’s your mom. {to phone} Ha-ha! What can I say? The camera loves me!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MONSTROPOLIS, MORNING
dialogues.text: The sun rises over Monstropolis, an industry town much li Pittsburg. Its ancient history is seen in the architectur A NEWSPAPER DELIVERY MONSTER tosses a paper on the stoop an apartment building. Mike and Sulley walk out the door, lunch boxes in hand.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m telling you big daddy, you’re going to be seeing this face on T.V. a lot more often.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Yeah? Like on “Monstropolis’ Most Wanted?”

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Ha, ha, ha. You’ve been jealous of my good looks since the fourth grade, pal. They walk by a TINY MONSTER HUSBAND AND WIFE.

dialogues.speaker: TINY MONSTER WIFE
dialogues.text: Have a good day, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: . TINY MONSTER HUSBAND
dialogues.text: You too, hon. The monster husband flies away.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MONSTROPOLIS CURBSIDE, MORNING
dialogues.text: Mike approaches a shiny new convertible and holds up a se keys.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, Sulley, hop on in!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Nope. Uh-uh. Sullivan grabs Mike’s arm and drags him away.  10. a “. MIKE ~~ Hey, hey, hey, where are you going?! What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Mikey, there’s a scream shortage. We're walking.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Walking?!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Yup!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: {being dragged away) No, no, no, no! My baby! Look! She needs to be driven! (to car) I’1l call you!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MONSTROPOLIS STREET, MORNING
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON NEWSPAPER STAND with headline: “ROLLING BLACKOUT EXPECTED.” Mike and Sulley walk past. Me MIKE Hey genius, you want to know why I bought the car?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: - To drive it! You know, like on the street? With the honk-honk, and the vroom-vroom, and no walking involved?!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Give it a rest, will ya, butterball? Come on, you could use the exercise.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I could use the exercise?! Look at you! You have your own climate!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MONSTROPOLIS APARTMENTS, MORNING
dialogues.text: MONSTER KIDS jump rope as Mike and Sulley pass.

dialogues.speaker: MONSTER KIDS
dialogues.text: (chanting) How many tentacles jump the rope? One and two and three and four... The rope is actually one of the kid’s tongues.

dialogues.speaker: MONSTER KID
dialogues.text: Morning, Mike! Morning, Sulley!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Hey, morning kids. How’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, kids!

dialogues.speaker: KID TONGUE MONSTER
dialogues.text: (turning her head) Bye, Mike! Bye Thulley! The JUMPING MONSTER KID gets tangled in the rope tongue a flies into a GIANT EYE MONSTER watching from a window.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT EYE MONSTER
dialogues.text: Ow! Hey!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MONSTROPOLIS STOREFRONT, MORNING
dialogues.text: A GARBAGE MONSTER sweeps garbage off the sidewalk into a DUSTPAN. He happily tosses the contents into his mouth. A monster reading a NEWSPAPER sneezes, and fire shoots fr his mouth and nose, incinerating his paper.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER MONSTER
dialogues.text: Aw, nuts.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MONSTROPOLIS GROSSERY STORE, MORNING
dialogues.text: TONY THE GROSSER arranges fruit on a stand with his many tentacles.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hey, fellas!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN/MIKE
dialogues.text: (Italian accent) Hey Tony! Hey, hey, hey!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Tony! Badda bing!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (chuckling) I hear somebody’s close to breaking the all-time scare record!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Aw, just trying to make sure there’s enough scream to go around. The grosser tosses Sulley and Mike two pieces of fruit.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hey! On the house!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Thanks!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Grazie!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Badda bing! Sullivan and Mike pass a GELATINOUS MONSTER who suddenly oozes through a grate and into the sewer below, leaving o EYES and TEETH atop the grate.

dialogues.speaker: BLOBBY
dialogues.text: Oh great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan and Mike wait to cross next to a giant monster, Because of his height, we only see Ted’s massive legs.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (yelling up to Ted) Hey, Ted! Good morning! Ted answers. The traffic sign changes from “DON’T STALK” to “STALK”. Sullivan, Mike, and Ted cross.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See that Mikey? Ted’s walking to work.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Big deal! Guy takes five steps and he’s there!  Mee 13. CLOSE ON BILLBOARD advertising Monsters, Inc. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MI FACTORY, MORNING
dialogues.text: The Monsters Incorporated parking lot fills with cars as workers stream into the enormous building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various Monster employees greet Mike and Sully as they en

dialogues.speaker: MISC. EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Morning, Sulley!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Morning, Ricky!

dialogues.speaker: MISC. EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s the Sullster!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: See ya on the scare floor, buddy!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey Marge! How was jury duty?

dialogues.speaker: MISC. EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Morning Sulley!

dialogues.speaker: MISC. EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: How’re you doing, big guy? Twelve SCARER OF THE MONTH photographs -- all of Sullivan hang on a lobby wall. Two geeky monsters, SMITTY and NEEDLEMAN, straighten one of them.

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: It‘s still leaning to the left!

dialogues.speaker: SMITTY
dialogues.text: It is not!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Hey fellas! Hey, Jerry!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Morning! The geeks hear Sullivan’s voice and run up to him.  14.

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Sullivan!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Guys, I told you, call me Sulley. The geeks LAUGH like school girls.

dialogues.speaker: SMITTY
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: We just wanted to wish you good luck today--

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey. Come on, get lost you two. You’re making him lose his focus.

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: (worried) Oh, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: See ya later, fellas. Sullivan heads off with Mike. ck

dialogues.speaker: SMITTY
dialogues.text: (calling after) .Go get ‘em, Mr. Sullivan!

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: Quiet! You’re making him lose his focus!

dialogues.speaker: SMITTY
dialogues.text: Oh no! (calling after again) Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CELIA is answering phone calls.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Monsters, Inc., please hold. Monsters Inc., I‘1l1 connect you. Ms. Fearmonger is on vacation, would you like her voicemail?  Ck 15. Sullivan and Mike approach the desk.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh, Shmoopsie-Poo... Celia turns with a big, bright smile. So do a collection SNAKES, which we now realize make up Celia’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Googley Bear! Her snakes SIGH contentedly.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Oh, Googley-Woogley, you remembered! Celia leans forward and gently rubs Mike’s head. They’re nauseatingly cute together.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Sullivan) Hey, Sulley-Wulley!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Oh hey, Celia... Weelia... Uhm, happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Thanks! (to Mike) So... are we going anywhere special tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got.us into a little place called... “Harry Hausen’s.”

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: (gasp!) Harry Hausen’s?! But it’s impossible to get a reservation there!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Not for Googley Bear. Celia giggles. So do the snakes.  16.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I will see you at quittin’ time and not a minute later!

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Okay, Sweetheart. Mike dances out of the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Think romantical thoughts! {singing} You and me, me and you, both of us, together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike opens a locker door and grabs a giant, clear bowl.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know pal, she’s the one. That’s it! She is the one!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I’m happy for ya.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh, and thanks for hooking me up with those reservations. a Mike puts the giant bowl -- his CONTACT LENS -- into his

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Oh, no problem. They’re under the name “Googley Bear.”

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh good idea- {catching the joke) You know, that wasn’t very funny. Mike’s locker suddenly slams shut by itself. Confused, Mi opens it. It slams shut again.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the...? A purple chameleon-like monster, RANDALL BOGGS, uncamofla and jumps out at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh! Mike flies backwards, tripping over the bench.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: (laughs) Well, whadda ya know? It scares little kids and little monsters.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I-I wasn’t scared, I have... allergies. |

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Randall. Save it for the scare floor, will ya? Randall performs a series of martial arts moves.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: I’m in the zone today, Sullivan. I‘m going to be doing some serious scaring, putting up some big numbers.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wow, Randall, that’s great. That should make it even more humiliating when we break the record first!

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Shhh. Do you hear that? Randall pauses for dramatic effect. RANDALL (cont'd) It’s the winds of change. Randall exits. Mike watches him go, smoldering.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (mocking) “You hear that? You hear the winds. of change?” What a creep! One of these days I am really going to,let you teach that guy a lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slug monster mops up a PUDDLE OF GREEN SLIME. He exits, leaving a TRAIL of more slime.  18.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Chalooby! Baby! ()

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ROZ’S DESK - CONTINUOUS CLOSE ON NEWSPAPER called “The Glob.”

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Good morning Roz, my succulent little garden snail, and who would we be scaring today? : Mike reaches for paperwork on the desk, but ROZ’s wet han lands on it first. She’s a slug-like monster with horn- rimmed glasses.

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: Wazowski. You didn’t file your paperwork last night.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (coy) Oh, that darn paperwork. Wouldn’t it be easier if it all just blew away? Roz leans forward in her chair threateningly. Ct

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: Don’t let it happen again.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes! Well, I’1l try to be less careless. Mike grabs the paperwork and shuffles away. :

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: (calling after him) I’m watching you, Wazowski. Always watching. Watching. Always.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (to self) Ooh, she’s nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks onto the Scare Floor, already bustling with activity.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ~ (over paging system) All scare floors now active. Assistants, please report to your stations.  f ck

dialogues.speaker: SCARE FLOOR PREPARATIONS
dialogues.text: - Mike fits an EMPTY CAN onto his door station. ~ Mike swipes a CARD-KEY from a child’s folder, and slide through a slot on the station. - A CHILD’S CLOSET DOOR rides out into the Scare Floor on OVERHEAD TRACK. - Several assistants follow suit. Doors ride out of the vault and land in stations. - A JUMBO-TRON screen displaying the MI logo switches ove amap. The eastern portion of the United States is illuminated as THE FLOOR MANAGER steps up.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR MANAGER
dialogues.text: Okay people, Eastern seaboard coming on line. We got Scarers coming out! The assistants run to their stations and stand at attenti

dialogues.speaker: IN SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: These are the best of the best; the top Scarers, ready fo action. Smitty and Needleman, two geeky teenage janitors, stand in awe on the sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: Oooh, they’re so awesome! The Scarers stop opposite their doors. Their assistants approach them and make last minute preparations. Sullivan cracks his knuckles and shakes to keep loose. A monster flips out his RETRACTABLE CLAWS like switchblad A toothless monster is handed a set of FALSE TEETH. He slides the chompers into place and snarls. Randall practices camouflaging by blending into various background patterns: wood, brick, wallpaper. His nerdy assistant FUNGUS alternates the patterns. A bald monster puts a tentacle in his mouth and blows. SPIKES pop out of his skin. A monster opens his mouth to reveal a giant set of SPIKED TEETH. His assistant brushes them.  20. A monster grabs a HANDFUL OF EYEBALLS from his assistant squishes them into his face. The Jumbo-tron now shows everyone’s SCARE TOTALS. Sulliva is at the top, with Randall in second place.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (with hand outstretched) Hey, may the best monster win.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: . FLOOR MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... five... four... three... two... The Floor Manager silently indicates “one” with his hand. Sign light above the Scare Floor changes from “STANDBY” t “SCARE.”

dialogues.speaker: THE SCARING BEGINS
dialogues.text: A horn sounds, and each Scarer rushes up to their door. Sulley disappears through the door.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You’re the boss, you’re the boss, you’re the big hairy boss! Randall and the other monsters follow suit. SCREAMS are heard from inside Sullivan’s door. Sulley exi and checks his new SCARE TOTALS on the jumbo-tron.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Oooh, I'm feeling good today, Mikey!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Whoa! That a boy! That a boy! Another door comin’ right up! A SCREAM comes from another door. Randall emerges to watc his tally go up, but only slightly.  (%. 21. Randall’s assistant FUNGUS scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: Hmm, you’re still behind, Randall. You know, maybe I should re-align the scream intake valve-~ ,

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Just get me another door!

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: (running off) Aaaaah! A door! Yes! SCARE FLOOR’ - CONTINUOUS The monsters work fast and furious. CHILDRENS’ SCREAMS ar heard everywhere, filling the cans. Waternoose walks up beside the Floor Manager.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: (expecting the worst) Well, Jerry, what's the damage.go far?

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: (unconvinced) Hmm. First time in a month.

dialogues.speaker: SCARE FLOOR
dialogues.text: A scream can gurgles as it registers EMPTY. ROCK MUSIC pounds as the door opens and a huge monster scrambles out the room, SOBBING pathetically.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.text: The kid almost touched me! She got this close to me!

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: She wasn’t scared of you? {looking through paperwork) She was only six!

dialogues.speaker: SCARED MONSTER
dialogues.text: I could’ve been dead! I could’ve died!!!  22. Le The assistant slaps the scared monster across the face

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: ‘Keep it together, man! (whistles for help) Hey, we got a dead door over here! The geeks come running, wheeling a portable door shredder

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: We're coming! Look out!

dialogues.speaker: SMITTY
dialogues.text: Out of the way! Excuse us!

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: Coming through! Needleman tapes a yellow “X” across the door.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR MANAGER
dialogues.text: {to Waternoose) . We've lost fifty-eight doors this week, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we Kids these days. They just don't get scared like they used to! The geeks load the defunct door into the shredder.

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: Let ‘er rip! The DOOR SHREDS with a buzz, spewing out sawdust and leav only TWO DOOR KNOBS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An octopus-like monster runs toward a door tentacles flyi

dialogues.speaker: TENTACLED MONSTER
dialogues.text: Bugabugabuga! Randall emerges from another door. He’s working hard.

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: (nervous) Uh, Sir? ae RANDALL What !?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L-look! Fungus points to the tally board. Randall’s name replaces Sullivan's as NUMBER ONE.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: (over P.A. system) Attention: we have a new scare leader- Randall Boggs. Several monsters gather around Randall, congratulating hi

dialogues.speaker: MISC. MONSTER ADMIRERS
dialogues.text: Nice job! You took the lead! You did it! Look at those numbers! MULTIPLE SCREAMS draw the attention of the admirers. In seconds, Mike deftly fills can after can with SCREAM. Sullivan emerges from the door and cracks his knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Slumber party. The tally board updates; Sullivan's back in first place.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: {over P.A. system) Never mind. The admirers push past Randall as they rush to Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: (being jostled) Hey, watch it!

dialogues.speaker: MISC. MONSTER ADMIRERS
dialogues.text: That was awesome! How did you do that? You‘re going to the hall of fame for . sure! Sullivan gives his fans a high five as Mr. Waternoose approaches.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Well, James, that was an impressive display.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Oh, just doing my job, Mr. Waternoose. Of course, I did learn from the best. Waternoonse and Sullivan both CHUCKLE.  24. os KR Randall watches angrily. Fungus stands next to him.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: ‘If I don’t see a new door in my station in five seconds, I will personally put you through the shredder!

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: (running off) Aaaaah! CHARLIE, the assistant at the next station, turns to Mike

dialogues.text: Hey, Wazowski! Nice job, those numbers are pretty sweet!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (false modesty) Are they? You know, I hadn’t even noticed. And how is Georgie doing?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He’s doing great! I love working with Y that big guy. “ Charlie’s door opens, and a goofy-looking furry monster GEORGE SANDERSON emerges.

dialogues.speaker: . GEORGE
dialogues.text: Keep the doors comin’, Charlie. I’m ona roll today!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (to Mike) George and I are like brothers. Charlie spots a CHILD’S SOCK on George’s back.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gasp!) Twenty-three nineteen! We have a twenty- three nineteen! : The Floor Manager hits a HUMAN CHILD EMERGENCY BUTTON. A SIREN BLARES. The Jumbo-tron reads “WARNING: CONTAMINATIO ALERT” .

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE, (OVER P.A.)
dialogues.text: Red Alert! Red Alert! Red Alert! George looks around, confused. On the Jumbo-tron behind h is a security cam view of George’s back, showing the sock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Sanderson, please remain motionless. Prepare for decontamination. Realizing he caused the alarms, George tries frantically remove the sock.

dialogues.speaker: " GEORGE
dialogues.text: Get it off! Get it off!

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR MANAGER
dialogues.text: Duck and cover, people! BANG! YELLOW-SUITED FIGURES rappel through the windows fr the ceiling overhead.

dialogues.text: Oh, not the CDA.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MONSTERS INC., DAY
dialogues.text: Helicopters hover over the factory as LARGE BLACK TRUCKS squeal into the parking lot. On the sides of the trucks i printed: CDA - CHILD DETECTION AGENCY. More yellow-suited figures -- CDA agents -~ burst out of truck and run toward the factory. INT. ROZ’S DESK Roz closes her desk window as CDA agents run by.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Coming through! Please stand aside!

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT

dialogues.speaker: SMITTY /NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: Aaaaah!

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: This is a twenty-three-nineteen in progress!

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Clear the area people}!  ry) 26.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Coming through. Watch yourself! CDA agents run up to George and tackle him to the ground. Using tongs, they gently remove the sock from his back an place it on the floor. A METAL DOME is bolted over the so Waternoose and MI workers cover their eyes. Mike GASPS as a blinding flash emerges from under the met device. Agents unbolt the dome and vacuum up the charred remains of the sock.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: All clear. Situation is niner-niner- zero. Ready for decon.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to CDA agents) Hey, thanks guys, that was a close one.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: (to other Agents) Okay. A circular shower curtain flies up around George. A yello hand reaches in with a huge ELECTRIC RAZOR. George’s fur flies up over the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Abhhhh! A small shower head pops up, spraying DISINFECTANT. © GEORGE (cont’d) Eiieeee! The curtain flies open. George is entirely shaved, wearin an Elizabethan dog collar. A band-aid covers the area “contaminated" by the sock. An agent rips the band-aid of

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh! A sign on the wall reading DAYS SINCE LAST ACCIDENT flips from 47 to 0.

dialogues.text: Okay people, take a break! We gotta shut down for a half-hour and reset the system!  pu 27. Waternoose and Sullivan watch as CDA agents file off the Scare Floor.

dialogues.text: An entire scare floor out of commission. What else can go wrong?

dialogues.text: Waternoose and Sullivan approach the coffee machine. Waternoose pours himself a cup of the thick gooey liquid.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Oh, what a day.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: We’re just going through a rough time, Sir. Everyone knows you’re going to get us through it.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Tell that to the board of directors. James, this company has been in my family for three generations. I would do anything to keep it from going under.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: So would I, Sir. Waternoose is suddenly struck with an idea.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Say! I could use your help with something.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: os Anything, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: You see, we've hired some new scare recruits, and frankly they‘re... they’re,.. uh...

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Inexperienced?

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: They stink.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Uh huh.  28.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: I thought maybe you might come by tomorrow and give them a demonstration. Show them what it takes to be a top Scarer, eh?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (grinning) . I‘11 start out with the old Waternoose jump and growl! Sullivan demonstrates the “old Waternoose jump and growl” Waternoose is so startled that he drops his coffee cup.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Aaah! (amused) Ha ha! Oh, yes! Now that’s my boy! Waternoose pats Sullivan on the shoulder. They LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MI FACTORY, SUNSET
dialogues.text: The sun sets over Monsters Inc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bell RINGS as the factory winds down. The “SCARE” light turned off, and tired Scarers emerge from doors.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR MANAGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let’s go everybody. All doors must be returned. No exceptions! All doors are ejected and return to the vault.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Whoo! I’ve never seen anything like you today! You were on a roll, my man!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Another day like this and that scare record's in the bag!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s right baby! SULLIVAN . Uh huh! The overhead lights turn off as everyone leaves for the d

dialogues.text: Sullivan and Mike are at their lockers.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So get this. As if dinner wasn’t enough, I’m taking her to a monster truck rally afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.text: What’s on your agenda?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I’m going to head home and work out some more.

dialogues.text: Again? You know, there’s more to life than scaring! Mike sniffs under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me Phew! Hey, can I borrow your odorant?

dialogues.speaker: _ SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got smelly garbage, or old dumpster.

dialogues.text: You got low tide?

dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: How about wet dog?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Yup. Stink it up. Sullivan tosses Mike the can of “odorant.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan and Mike walk down a crowded hallway.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know, I am so romantic, sometimes I think I should just marry myself.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Give me a break, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What a night of romance I’ve got ahead of me. Tonight is about me, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike spots Celia tidying up her desk.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (love-struck) Celia! The love boat is about to set sail! {imitates boat horn) (then, to Sullivan) . I gotta tell you Buddy, that face of hers it just makes my heart go... Yikes! As Mike turns back to Celia, he is surprised to instead s Roz.

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: Hello, Wazowski. Fun filled evening planned for tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well, as a matter of fact-

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: And I’m'sure you filed your paperwork correctly. For once. Mike freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ROZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your stunned silence is very reassuring. Roz slithers away.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: {to Sulley) Oh no, my scare reports! I left them on my desk! If I’m not at the restaurant in five minutes, they’re going to give our table away! What am I going to tell... Celia leaps in and squeezes Mike’s cheek. MIKE (cont’d) Shmoopsie Poo!

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Hey, Googley Bear! Want to get going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, do I ever... It’s just that... uh, you know it’s... there’s a small...

dialogues.text: I don’t understand you...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s just that--

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: It’s just that I forgot about some paperwork I was supposed to file. Mike was reminding me. Thanks, buddy. Whew!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I was? I mean, I was! Yeah, I was.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay, let‘’s go then.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We’re going! (whispers to Sullivan) On my desk, Sulley! The pink copies go to accounting, the fuchsia ones go to purchasing, and the goldenrod ones go to Roz. Celia grabs Mike and pulls him away. Mike leans back. MIKE (cont’d) Leave the puce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor is dark and empty as Sullivan walks to Mike’s d

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: The pink copies go to accounting, the fuchsia ones go to Roz. No, the fuchsia ones go to purchasing, and the goldenrod ones go to Roz. And I have no idea what puce is... Sullivan picks up the paperwork and shuffles through it. SULLIVAN (cont’d) Oh, that’s puce.

Turning, Sullivan sees A LONE DOOR in a station. SULLIVAN {cont‘d) ‘Hello? Anyone? There’s a door here. Sullivan walks to the door. He’s about to eject it when h notices that the light above the station is illuminated. It’s ACTIVE. Cautiously, he opens the door. INT. LITTLE GIRL’S BEDROOM, NIGHT Sullivan peeks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (stage whisper) Hello? Hey! Psst. Anybody scaring in here? Hello? Hello! Nothing but crickets. Sullivan shrugs and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulley steps away from the door, examining it curiously.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Hmmm... Suddenly, there is a THUMP noise behind him. Sulley freez THUMP, He turns around to see his tail being dropped by..

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Duckit. | Sulley SCREAMS, falling over backward. The girl looks up at Sulley and smiles. This guy’s funny! Panicked, Sulley picks her up with a pair of tongs and pl her back in her room, closes the door and spins around... only to discover that she’s standing before him again. She SQUEALS with delight. Sullivan YELLS. He picks her up and carries her deep inside the room. INT. LITTLE GIRL‘'S BEDROOM Sullivan deposits the kid on top of her bed. She GIGGLES.  oe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs out, but gets caught in a hanging mobile. He fall trips over a laundry basket, slips on a rug, and is eject out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan slides out of the room, COVERED IN TOYS AND JUNK from the kid’s room. Suddenly, from the utility hallway, hears a noise. SOMEONE'S COMING! Sullivan scrambles to his feet and takes off. As he runs, line of TOY DUCKIES caught on his tail quack along after

dialogues.text: Randall enters, wheeling a cart of SCREAM CANS towards th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan rushes to the toilets, stuffs the kid junk into bowl, and flushes it down.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Whew! A second later it all comes back up, overflowing the toil SULLIVAN (cont‘d) Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan spots an open locker and stuffs the sopping kids in. He closes the locker. Relieved, Sullivan turns and walks away. On his back, clinging to his: fur, is THE LITTLE GIRL. Sulley rounds the locker bank and disappears from view. F a moment, all is quiet. A second later:

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhh! Sullivan runs back past the lockers, panic-stricken. The girl chases him.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Kitty!  f 34.

dialogues.speaker: INT, LOCKER ROOM
dialogues.text: Sullivan cowers on a bench, backed into a corner of the r The kid stands in front of him waving her arms. To Sulley she is like a diseased rat.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: No no, stay back... The little girl is distracted, playing with a hardhat. Sullivan finds an M.I. GYM BAG, scoops her up, and zips i closed. Holding the bag at arms length, he runs out of th room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan runs to the kid’s door, ready to toss the kid ba in. As he reaches to open it, the knob rattles. Oh no! He’s standing in the middle of the Scare Floor. Where to hide? Randall emerges from the door, confused. Why wasn’t there kid in that room?

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: . Randall EJECTS the door. As Randall walks away, the doo rises, revealing Sullivan hidden behind it. The little girl wiggles inside the bag and makes a PEEP. Randall stops. Has he heard? No, he SNEEZES and continues As Randall exits the floor, Sullivan watches as the kid’s door disappears into the vault, and with it all hope of getting rid of the kid. Sulley grabs the gym bag and runs towards the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHOP! A cleaver chops through a piece of raw monster fish This is HARRY HAUSEN’S, a top Monstropolis eatery. A mult tentacled monster sushi chef prepares elegant meals as waiters waltz by with Sushi. When new customers enter the restaurant, the waiters all YELL. .

dialogues.speaker: WAITERS
dialogues.text: Eerie shai massay! Mike and Celia are seated in a romantic booth, LAUGHING.  35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “ Oh, Michael. Ive had a lot of. birthda-- well, not a lot of birthdays... but this is the best birthday ever. Mike gazes dreamily at Celia. She grows self-conscious. CELIA (cont’d) What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh, I was just thinking about the first time I laid eye on you, how pretty you looked.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Your hair was shorter then.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Uh huh, I’m thinking about getting it cut. The snakes look panicked.

dialogues.speaker: . MIKE
dialogues.text: No, no, I like it this length. The snakes sigh in relief.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I like everything about you. Just the other day, someone asked me who I thought the most beautiful monster was, in all of Monstropolis. Do you know what I said?

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: (coy) What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I said... Behind Celia, Sullivan presses his face up to the window. MIKE (cont’d) Sulley!

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Sulley?  36. Befuddled, Mike looks to the window. Sullivan is gone.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: -No, no, no! That’s not what I was going to say! I mean, well sure, he’s handsome... if you like the big, rugged, hairy...

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Mike, you're not making sense.

dialogues.speaker: SUSHI CHEFS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Eerie Shai Massay! Sullivan appears at the table and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (nervous) Hi guys! What a coincidence, running into you here! Sullivan awkwardly squeezes into the booth next to Mike, setting the gym bag under the table.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: a Uh, I’m just going to order something to MS go.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Michael...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: {through gritted teeth) Sulley... Sulley grabs a menu and whips it in front of his and Mike faces. . .

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I wonder what’s good here! Hmmm... Sulley and Mike WHISPER behind the menu.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: . Get outta here, you’re ruining everything!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I went back to get your paperwork, and . there was a door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Mike peeks. around the menu, grins awkwardly at Celia, th ducks back behind. Celia‘s starting to steam. Her snakes rattle in annoyance

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A door?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: {nodding) Randall was in it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Randall? (putting it together) That cheater! He’s trying to boost his numbers!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: There's something else...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: - What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooklay in the agbay.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Look in the bag! Sulley motions to the floor. Mike ducks under the table, but there's nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What bag? Sullivan looks around frantically for the bag. Mike sees something that make his eye goes wide. Sulley sees it too The MI duffle bag is now GIGGLING and hobbling away on li human kid-feet that poke out from the bottom of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: WHOOAHHH!! They don’t have anything I like here, so take care, Celia!  (4. 38. Sullivan charges toward the bag, stumbling into a waiter.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Michael, what’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Celia, please try to understand... As Mike explains, he sees the bag tossed aside, revealing HUMAN CHILD. MIKE (cont’d) I have to DO SOMETHING! Mike dashes off.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Michael?! A MONSTER PHOTOGRAPHER is about to take a picture of a ha MONSTER COUPLE.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look happy. Okay, on three. One... two... The posing couple sees the kid pop up over the photograph shoulder. They SCREAM. The photographer looks up and sees the kid.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaahh! A kid! The photographer's flash goes off, as the kid jumps onto counter. Everyone in the restaurant turns towards the chi

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: {to restaurant) Boo! Chaos ensues. Patrons scramble out the door, SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: MISC. MONSTER
dialogues.text: A kid!!! The sushi chef grabs a phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: SUSHI CHEF
dialogues.text: (into phone) There’s a kid here! A human kid! The girl runs carefree through the chaos, BABBLING.  cs
Mike runs headlong into a pile of TAKE-OUT BOXES. _ Celia is caught up in the stampede of fleeing patrons.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: {calling out) Googley Bear! Sullivan tries to grab the kid, but she playfully evades outstretched arms.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Come on! Oh! Heh! Mike dashes in with a takeout box, which he uses to delicately scoop her up. The girl pops her head out of the takeout box and sticks her tongue at Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Pthbthbtht! Sullivan hesitantly pushes her head down into the box and shuts the lid.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Come on! Sulley and Mike run out of the restaurant, leaving the MI BAG behind.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here! The CDA arrives in helicopters and vans.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: We have an 835 in progress, please advise.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Stand clear please. Monsters run amok, screaming. Celia calls after Mike.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Michael? Michael!  Cy
Mike spins around.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Celia! A CDA agent steps in front of Celia and herds her away.

dialogues.speaker: . CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Come with us, please.

dialogues.text: Hey! Get your hands off my Schmoopsie- poo- Sullivan grabs Mike and yanks him away.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT

dialogues.text: Well, I don’t think that date could have gone any worse! BLAM!!! Behind them a GIANT GREEN PLASMA DOME envelops th restaurant and glows ominously. Things just got worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same image of the restaurant becomes part of a news report, with the word, “KID-TASTROPHE!” superimposed over A NEWSCASTER talks to camera.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: If witnesses are to be believed, there has been a child security breach for the first time in monster history.  ey Ck 41.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With chaos behind them, panicked Monsters speaks into cam

dialogues.text: Well, the kid flew right over me and blasted a car with its laser vision!

dialogues.speaker: MISC MONSTER
dialogues.text: I tried to run from it, but it picked me up with its mind powers and shook me like a doll! A monster with dozens of eyes steps forward to corroborat

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: It is my professional opinion that now is the time to panic! INT. MIKE AND SULLIVAN’S LIVING ROOM, NIGHT CRASH! Mike and Sulley’s TV smashes to the floor. The little girl’s head peeks out over the set.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: (cheery) Uh oh! Sullivan and Mike wear COLANDERS, SNORKEL MASKS, and OVEN MITTS for protection. They see the kid and SCREAM, scrambling behind a chair for protection.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s coming! It’s coming!  Ch

dialogues.text: Boo!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE/SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Aaah! Sullivan and Mike flee over to the window. Outside, HELICOPTERS scan the area. Hurriedly Mike and Sulley yank the shades closed. The girl totters towards them, babbling. Mike and Sulley retreat in fear.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE/SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaah! The kid opens the window shade, standing in full view of helicopters outside. Mike scoots her out of view using a broom, then sprays th area with DISINFECTANT. : Meanwhile the girl has discovered Mike’s CD collection, neatly arranged in two stacks.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No! Don’t touch those, you little-- The stacks come CRASHING down. MIKE (cont’d) Oh, those were alphabetized! It’s okay, it’s alright! As long as it doesn’t come near us, we’re gonna be okay. The girl SNEEZES directly in Mike’s eye.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ahhh! . Mike freaks, spraying disinfectant squarely into his own MIKE (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: YAHHH
dialogues.text: Now the kid approaches Sullivan. Whimpering, he protects himself with a garbage can lid. The kid points to a ONE EYED TEDDY BEAR, out of her reach

dialogues.text: Oh, here you like this? Fetch!
Sullivan tosses the bear across the room. The kid runs af it. She picks up the bear and hugs it. Mike GASPS. This has gone too far.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, that’s it! No one touches little Mikey! Mike swipes the bear out of the kid’s hands. Stunned, her face begins to REDDEN, and her eyes well up with TEARS.

dialogues.text: Mike, give her the bear.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh no... The kid SCREAMS at the top of her lungs. Sullivan and Mike cover their ears. The LIGHTS in the apartment SURGE. EXT. MIKE AND SULLEY’S APARTMENT, NIGHT From outside, the apartment lights PULSE BRIGHTLY, creati beacon for the helicopters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The circling helicopters head towards them. Mike and Sullivan panic. Mike DROPS THE BEAR and runs to the windo pulling the shade shut. .

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Ahh! Make it stop Sulley! Make it stop! The girl continues to wail. Desperate, Sullivan offers he the bear.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Here! See the bear? Ooo, nice bear! It’s not working -- she continues to cry. The helicopters are getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: MIRE
dialogues.text: Sulley! Desperate, Sullivan begins to DANCE with the bear; anythi to get her to stop crying.  i f o% 44.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (singing) Oh, he’s a happy bear, and he’s not crying, and neither should you, or we'll be in trouble, ‘cause they’re gonna find us, so please stop crying, right now, right now... The kid stops crying. The lights return to normal levels.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Good! Good, Sulley, keep it up, you’re doin’ great! The helicopters turn around and begin to fly away.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Ooo, ah, the happy bear, he has no care... The girl reaches for the bear, accidentally TOUCHING SULLIVAN’S HAND. He SCREAMS. SULLIVAN (cont’d) Bwaaaaah! Yaah! It touched me!! She touched me! Aaah! Sulley’s yelling frightens the kid, who starts CRYING aga The LIGHTS SURGE. Mike runs toward Sullivan, reaching for the bear.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sulley, the bear! The bear! Give it the- Mike trips on a lamp and flies across.the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoahhhhh ! Mike rolls into a garbage can and bumps into a shelf, sen a STACK OF BOOKS into his mouth. A hanging STEREO SPEAKER lands on his head. MIKE (cont’d) Oof! The kid thinks this is hilarious and begins LAUGHING. The lights in the apartment GLOW EVEN BRIGHTER than before.  i ' 45. EXT. MIKE AND SULLEY’S APARTMENT, NIGHT The region lit up by the laugh’s power radiates outwards from Mike and Sulley’s window. In a moment ALL THE APARTM WINDOWS are GLOWING BRIGHTLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights flare to a white hot brightness, and then POP. The laughter subsides, and all is dark.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: What was that? Mike is still wedged inside the garbage can.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I have no idea. But it would be really great if it didn’t do it again. The girl GIGGLES again.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Shhhh! She seems to understand. She nods and holds her tiny fing up to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Shhhh.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (nodding) She smiles. . INT. MIKE AND SULLIVAN’S LIVING ROOM - LATER The room is lit by CANDLELIGHT. The kid sits at one end o the room COLORING while at the other end Mike and Sulley hunker behind a chair, tossing her pieces of cereal.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: How could I do this? How could I be so stupid? This could destroy the company!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The company? Who cares about the company? What about us? That thing is a killing machine!  Ck 46. The girl spins around in a circle, getting dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: La la la la la la la la...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I bet it’s just waiting for us to fall asleep, and then, WHAM! We’re easy prey my friend, easy prey! We’re sitting targets! She falls over. Mike holds up a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, look, I think I have a plan here. Using mainly spoons, we dig a tunnel under the city, and release it into the wild. Sullivan stares in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Spoons. Mike crumples up the piece of paper, and tosses it onto a large existing pile of crumpled plans.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s it, I’m out of ideas. We’re closed. Hot air balloons, too expensive. Giant slingshot, too conspicuous. Enormous wooden horse, too Greek! The girl holds up a drawing.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Looka dooko teeko peeka! Sulley can’t quite believe his eyes. The drawing is crude but its unmistakably a picture of SULLEY AND THE GIRL HOL HANDS.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (muttering to self) No plan... mo plan... can’t think... can’t think. Flat-lining...flat-lining. The kid yawns.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Uh, Mike, I think she’s getting tired.  47.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well! Then why don’t you find some place for it to sleep WHILE I THINK OF A PLAN! Sullivan speaks to the kid as though one might talk to a

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: So... you sleepy? You wanna sleep? Is that what you want? Huh? She blinks sleepily. INT. SULLIVAN’S ROOM Sullivan lays A TRAIL OF CEREAL leading to the corner of room. The kid follows, eating her way along the trail. Sullivan spreads some newspaper on the floor and pours a of cereal on it.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Okay, alright, I’m making a nice, little area for you to-- Sulley hears a GIGGLE. He turns around to find the kid in his bed.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, hey! That’s my bed! You’re gonna get your germs all over it! The kid snuggles into the covers. SULLIVAN (cont’d) Fine. My chair’s more comfortable anyway. Sullivan starts to walk out, but the kid WHINES anxiously

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? She’s pointing at his closet, MUMBLING.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It‘s just a closet. Will you go to sleep? The girl holds up one of her drawings.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, that looks like Randall. (puts it together) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cy 48.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Randall's your monster! You think he’s gonna come through the closet and scare you? Oh boy, how do I explain this... Uh, it’s empty. See? Sullivan opens the closet. She pulls covers over her head

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No monster in here! Sullivan steps inside. SULLIVAN (CONT‘D) Well, now there is... but I’m not gonna scare you. I’m off duty. Sullivan steps out. The kid looks into the closet intentl His little demo hasn’t quite done the trick; she’s still afraid.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (resigned) Okay, how ‘bout I sit here until you fall asleep? Sullivan closes the door and SITS in front of the closet. The kid stares back at him, WIDE AWAKE.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go ahead, go to sleep. Now. Now! Go... She’s not getting it. Sullivan tries to mime his words. SULLIVAN (cont’d) Uh, you... go... to... sleep! (snore!) She giggles for a moment, then passes out. Sullivan breat a sigh of relief. Sullivan watches the kid sleep, a tiny figure in his gian bed. Funny, she doesn’t look dangerous... Sulley quietly walks out of the room, shutting the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Hey Mike, this might sound crazy, but I don't think that kid’s dangerous.  as

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Really? Well in that case, let’s keep it. I always wanted a pet that could kill me!! SULLIVAN . Now look, what if we just put her back in her door?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Mike, think about it, if we send her back, it’s like it never happened. Everything goes back to normal!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Is that a joke? Tell me you’re joking. Sullivan isn’t kidding.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sulley, I‘d like to think that given the circumstances, I have been extremely forgiving up ‘til now, but that is a horrible idea! What are we gonna do, march right out into public with that thing? Then I guess we just waltz right up to the factory, right? As Sulley listens to Mike, his eyes are drawn to the PURP FABRIC of his reclining chair.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. M.I,. FRONT ENTRANCE, DAY
dialogues.text: The PURPLE FABRIC of Sulley’s chair has now been reconstructed into a makeshift MONSTER COSTUME.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe we are waltzing right up to the factory. Sulley, a mop, a couple of lights and some chair fabric are not gonna fool anyone! Just think about a few names will ya? Loch Ness, Big Foot, The Abominable Snowman. They all got one thing in common pal: banishment! We could be next! .

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Don‘t panic! We can do this.  50. As they approach the lobby doors, a fellow worker emerges Sullivan turns, keeping the kid hidden behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, how you doing, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. Sullivan and Mike walk through the door into Monsters Inc

dialogues.text: Everything’s going to be okay.

dialogues.text: CDA AGENTS are everywhere, combing the place.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Number One wants this place dusted for prints... They inspect a garbage can.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Careful with that... They hang from the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: I got a good view from here...

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Little lower... The LEAD CDA AGENT shows the CHARRED REMAINS of the MI GY BAG to Waternoose.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: This was recovered at the scene. Mike and Sulley barely dare to move.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Don’t panic. Don’t panic!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me not to panic! This is not okay, it’s not okay!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Just stay calm!  Cr)

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Boo! Sullivan and Mike turn toward the NOISE. The costumed kid waddling up to Mr. Waternoose. Mike and Sully are panic-stricken.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: (to CDA) Gentlemen, safety is our number one concern. Now if there’s anything that-- The kid tugs on Waternoose’s arm. He turns around, annoye

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not now, not now, I’m... (seeing the kid) Oh! Hello, little one. Where did you come from?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Waternoose! Sullivan and Mike run up.

dialogues.speaker: _ WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Aha, James! Is this one yours? Sullivan quickly sweeps the kid up into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Uh, actually, that’s my cousin’s... Sister’s... daughter, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s... ah... “Bring An Obscure Relative to Work Day.”

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Hmmm, must have missed the memo. Well, listen James, why don’t you stop by the simulator after lunch today and give us that scare demonstration we talked about, 2

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Oh! Sir, uh... today might be a little-- The LEAD CDA AGENT is anxious to get on with their work.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Waternoose...  52.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, I’m coming. (to Sullivan) - Alright, then, I’1l see you this afternoon, James. That is, if these gentlemen haven’t shut us down. Mr. Waternoose exits with the CDA.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Oh boy. +

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh, a scare demo! Well that is great. Why am I the last to know? We can bring your cousin’s sister’s daughter along. She’1l be a big hit! As .they walk off, a CDA agent scans the area with a CHIL DETECTOR. The agent points it towards the kid just as a random monster walks between them. The detector BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENTS
dialogues.text: Halt! Stop him! The CDA agents TACKLE the unsuspecting monster. ‘Mike and Sullivan look back at the melee, and scurry out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan, Mike, and the kid appear cautiously from behind row of lockers.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Come on, the coast is clear! Okay, all we have to do is get rid of that “thing.” So wait here, while I get its card key.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: But she can’t stay here. This is the men’s room, . Mike stares at Sullivan as if. he is insane.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That is the weirdest thing you have ever said. It’s fine! It’s okay! Look, it loves it here! it’s dancing with joy! The kid is indeed dancing.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (exiting) I’1l be right back with its door key. Sullivan looks down at the girl who is wiggling and MUMBL

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Haha! That’s a cute little dance you’ve got. It almost looks like you got to-- ‘The girl lifts the hood of her costume. Her face is uncomfortably scrunched. Her hands (flippers) grab at her “lower region.”

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (realizing) Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan stands waiting in front of a bathroom stall. Ins the kid SINGS.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Uh... are you done in there?. Sullivan starts to poke the door open.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Aah! Sorry! Sorry. Sullivan closes the door, embarrassed. The song continues. The singing stops. Then finally, a FLUSH.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, you're finished now, right? Hello? Sullivan slowly opens the door. The stall is EMPTY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes in as the water in the giant toilet swirls arou Surely she’s gone down. He’s about to jam his arm into th bowl when... :

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Boo!  fo é f 54. Sullivan spins around to find the girl standing behind hi

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (relieved) Whew! The girl wears a big goofy grin that says “Gotcha!” She GIGGLES, then scampers off to hide behind another stalls. Sullivan chuckles as he walks toward her.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (over-selling) Where did she go? Did she disappear? Did she turn invisible? I just have no idea! She GIGGLES in her stall, enjoying the game. Sullivan pau in front of her stall, then turns and OPENS it.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotcha! It’s empty!

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Boo! She peeks out from a DIFFERENT STALL.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: {genuinely impressed) Hey, you’re good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike prepares himself and walks towards Roz’s station.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (to self) Be relaxed, be relaxed, be relaxed. INT. ROZ’S STATION Mike approaches Roz’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Roz, my tender, oozing blossom, you’re looking fabulous today. Is that a new haircut? Roz stares back at him, expressionless.  ry

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, tell me it’s a new haircut, isn’t it? That's got to be a new haircut. New make-up? You’ve had a lift. You've had a tuck. You’ve had something. . Something has been inserted in your skin that makes you look like- She’s unmoved. MIKE (cont’d) Listen, I need a favor. Randall was working late last night out on the Scare Floor. I really need the key for the door he was using.

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: Well, isn’t that nice. But guess what? You didn’t turn in your paperwork last night.

dialogues.speaker: . MIKE
dialogues.text: He didn- I mean I- No? P-p-paperwork?

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: This office is now closed. ‘Roz slams the front panel of her desk on Mike’s fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan crawls playfully along the row of stalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready or not, here I come! I’m getting warmer! Any second now! Fee, fi, foe... Mike enters, rubbing his sore fingers.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (standing) Uh... I’m, uh, looking for the kid.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You lost it?!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: No, no, she was just~- The girl runs up and latches onto Sullivan‘’s arm, WHIMPE

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here she is. (to the kid, comforting) Hey, what’s the matter? Mike and Sullivan hear Randall approaching.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look, I already told your buddies I haven’t seen anything!

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Alright. Carry on. Sullivan, Mike and the kid duck into a stall and scramble atop the toilet to avoid being spotted. Randall enters th bathroom, growling. Randall washes his hands. The kid sees him through the cr in the door and WHIMPERS. Sulley awkwardly does his best comfort her. SPLISH! Mike’s foot SLIPS into the toilet water. Randall stops. Did he hear something? :

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: {suddenly entering the room) Randall:

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: (startled) Aah!

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: Thank goodness. What are we going to do about the child?!

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Will you... shhhh! Randall grabs Fungus’ mouth, shutting him up. Randall disappears. Fungus looks around, confused. The last stall door in the row suddenly SLAMS open. Randa materializes.  o ‘ Fungus waits impatiently, pointing to the newspaper as ~ ‘Randall KICKS OPEN each stall door. The trio shudders in the stall, awaiting their turn. Just as Randall is about to kick open their door, Fungus in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: (impatiently) The front page! It’s on the front page! The child! The one you were after!

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Will you be quiet?! Don’t you think I’m aware of the situation? I was up all night trying to find it!

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: I did a simple calculation factoring in the size of the sushi restaurant. The child may have escaped!

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Yeah, well until we know for sure, we’re “ gonna act like nothing happened, we understand? You just get the machine up and running, I’1l take care of the kid. And when I find whoever let it out... they’re dead! Randall angrily hits the stall door. It swings open, exposing Sulley, Mike and the kid. It swings shut again.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Fungus) Why are you still here?. Come on! Go! Move! Now!

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: (flustered) . Oh! Yes! I’m going! I’m not here! Randall and Fungus exit.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) They’re gone. Beat. Mike slips. From behind the stall, toilet water splashes onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ewww.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike’s wet feet clod down the hallway dragging toilet pap

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: This is bad. This is so very bad.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: What were they talking about, a machine?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Look, don’t panic. All we have to do is call her door down and send her home.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You’re right, you’re right. We’re just two regular joes, on our way to work. We will blend right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio walks across the Scare Floor, whistling nonchala and loudly greeting co-workers.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Top of the mornin’ fellas!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No, no, no, No, NO, NO!!!  79.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Eeeh!  80.

dialogues.speaker: NO WATERNOOSE

dialogues.speaker: " WATERNOOSE

His GLARING EYES and SNARLING TEETH are genuinely horrifying. Sullivan has bec a GRUESOME, TERRIBLE MONSTER. . Boo’s face WIDENS IN FEAR. The recruits are impressed.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Boo?. Sullivan reaches for Boo, trying to calm and reassure her Boo struggles to get away. SULLIVAN (cont ‘d) Boo? Boo, it’s me. She backs away from Sullivan and trips over a cable. Her HOOD FLOPS OPEN, revealing her SCARED FACE. :

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: (Gasp!) The child! Mike rushes in to explain.

As Mike continues, Sullivan approaches Boo, who is petrif

That wasn’t real, it’s just that...I was just- Behind Boo is the bank of monitors, displaying a still im of SULLIVAN'S FEARSOME ROAR. This is the way hundreds of children see him every night in their rooms. This is what Boo saw. Sullivan looks down at Boo, who is CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Boo. She run from Sullivan towards Waternoose, hiding behind o of his crab legs.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Boo! Mike is still explaining the situation to Waternoose.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: ...and he is trying to kill us! This whole thing is Randali‘s fault!

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Randall?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes! And we can take you to his secret lab, which is right here in this factory. Waternoose is stunned. He lets this information sink in.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: How could this happen? How could this happen? ! (beat) Does anyone else know about. this?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No, Sir.  83.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Good. ‘This company can’t afford any more bad publicity. Now, before we do anything else, let‘s take care of the child. Waternoose picks up Boo. Sullivan watches her, full of remorse.

dialogues.text: Waternoose flips a switch and the simmlator door EJECTS, like the Scare Floor. It travels away on an overhead trac

But now we can set everything straight again, for the good of the company. . Sulley tries in vain to catch Boo’s eye. A HUGE METAL DOOR lowers into the station with a BANG.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Uh, Sir, that’s not her door.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE

dialogues.speaker: MIKE/ SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Aaaaahhhhhhh! ! !

dialogues.text: A blizzard rages. Sulley and Mike land face down in the snow. Waternoose stands in the doorway, holding Boo. Sullivan makes a run for the door, but it’s slammed in his face.  {rk 84.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Boo!!! Mike and Sulley are in the middle of a SNOWY MOUNTAIN RAN Panicked, Sullivan opens and slams the door, but nothing changes.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s too late! We’re banished, genius! We‘re in the human world! Oh, what a great idea going to your old pal Waternoose! Too bad he was in on the whole thing! All you had to do was listen to me, just once! But you didn’t, aid you?! Sullivan desperately runs his hands along the sides of th door, looking for anything that might activate it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're still not listening!!! AAAAAAAAAAhhh ! Mike leaps onto Sullivan’s back, sending both of them tumbling down the side of the snowy mountain.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN/MIKE
