dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Take that! Suddenly, a HUGE SHADOW covers them. They look up to see

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Himalayas!  ¢ ‘
INT. YETI’S CAVE

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Abominable! Can you believe that? Do I look abominable to you? Mike huddles around the lantern for warmth. He’s wearing mittens on his horns, hands and feet.

dialogues.speaker: YETI, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why can’t they call me the “adorable snowman?” Or the “agreeable” snowman for erying out loud? I'm a nice guy. (offering) Snowcone? The Yeti holds out a tray of yellow snowcones. MIKE © (disgusted) Yeech.

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, no. Don’t worry. It’s lemon. (to Sullivan) How about you, big fella? Snowcone? Sullivan sits at the mouth of the cave, staring at his ha

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) Did you see the way she looked at me? In anguish, he buries his face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: -Oh, poor guy. I understand. It ain’t easy being banished. Take my buddy Bigfoot. When he was banished he fashioned an enormous diaper out of poison ivy and wore it on his head like a tiara. Called himself “King Itchy.” Mike looks up at Yeti as though he’s insane. YETI (CONT’D) Tt won’t be so hard for you guys. How lucky can you get? Banished with your best friend.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: He is not my friend:  ay 86.

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Oh! I just assumed you were buddies, when I saw you out there in the snow, hugging and all... Mike stares angrily at Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look at that big jerk. Ruined my life, and for what? (yelling to Sullivan) A stupid kid! Because of you, I am now stuck in this frozen wasteland!

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Wasteland? I think you mean w and! I mean, how ‘bout all this fabulous snow, huh? And wait ‘til you see the local village- cutest thing in the world! I haven’t even mentioned all the free Yak’s milk... For the first time, Sullivan turns, his eyes alive.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Uh, yak’s milk. Milking a yak ain’t exactly a picnic, but you know, once you pick the hairs out, it’s very nutritious. Sullivan jumps up, runs across the cave, and grabs the Ye

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: No, no, something about a village! Where!? Are there kids in it?

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Kids? Sure! Tough kids, sissy kids, kids who climb on rocks... This diversion is more that Sullivan can handle

dialogues.speaker: YETI

Sulley PUNCHES the wall in frustration, sending A PIECE O ICE across the floor. It stops in front of a PILE OF HIKER PARAPHERNALIA piled in the corner of the cave. Sulley’s eyes light up. He has an idea. Yeti watches as Sullivan digs through the stuff. You wanna go to the village? number one out here, always... No.

dialogues.text: Okay, rule Never go out in a blizzard.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (focused on his task) We need A SNOWBALL hits Sullivan in the back. to get to Boo! Yeti points to Mike nervously -- he did it. Boo?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ignored

dialogues.text: What about us! Mike throws another snowcone.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ever since that kid came in you‘ve everything I’ve said. And now look where we are!

dialogues.speaker: SMACK
dialogues.text: We were Sulley! None of None of None of Great. doesn’t

dialogues.text: about to break the record, We would’ve had it made! SULLIVAN. that matters now.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: it matters? Wait a second... it matters?! Okay. That’s good. So now the truth comes out, it? There is an uncomfortable pause.

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Oh, would you look at that, we’re outta snowcones! Let me just go outside and make some more. The Yeti leaves.  r) a 88.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sulley, what about everything we ever worked for? Does that matter? Huh? And what about Celia? I’m never gonna see her again. Doesn’t that matter? Sullivan has finished building a MAKESHIFT TOBOGGAN. In silence, he slowly pushes it past Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And what about me? I’m your pal. I’m your best friend.. Don’t I matter? Sullivan stops at the mouth of the cave and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Mike. I’m sorry we're stuck out here. I didn’t mean for this to happen. But Boo’s in trouble. I think there might be a way to save her. If we can just get down to that--

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We? Whoa! We? No. There’s no “we” this time, pal. If you want to go out there and freeze to death, you be my guest. Because you’re on your own. Mike turns his back on Sullivan, folding his arms. There is nothing Sullivan can say. He turns and pushes th toboggan out of the cave. The cave grows dark. Mike stares in disbelief. Sullivan i gone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HIMALAYAN MOUNTAINSIDE, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Sullivan RACES down the mountainside on his makeshift sle The LANTERN dangles from a ski pole on the sled, lighting way as Sulley navigates the treacherous terrain. He zips by the Yeti, holding a fresh tray of snow.

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Hey, I got more snowcones! The sled narrowly missing boulders, and picking up speed until...

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Whoa!  f ch

Sullivan's sled SMASHES into a boulder, and bursts apart. tumbles down the mountainside, finally sliding to a stop, face down in the snow. Sulley lies motionless in the snow, the wind howling thro his fur. A child SCREAMS in the distance. Or was that the wind? Sullivan slowly lifts his head. Another SCREAM, this one louder than the first. Sullivan' eyes widen. Through the snow, Sullivan can barely make out a SMALL TIBETAN VILLAGE.

dialogues.text: (resolved) You know, you’re right. (hands Charlie his crutch) Here, take this.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Go get ‘em, Georgie! As George. steps up to the door, Sullivan bursts through, TRAMPLING George.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: . see... Gangway!. Look out! __Coming_through! George lies flattened on the ground. SULLIVAN (cont ’d) (calling back) Sorry, George!

dialogues.text: What the --? Hey! You can’t just- As George staggers to his feet, Charlie spots a SOCK stuc his chest. Charlie’s eyes go wide.  ('. 90.

dialogues.text: (Gasp!) Twenty-three nine-- Before Charlie can finish, George GRABS him by the throat stuffs the sock in his mouth, and tosses him in the child bedroom. George relaxes, whistling happily as he walks away.

dialogues.text: (to Randall) . Finally! I never should have trusted you with this. Because of you, I had to banish my top scarer!

dialogues.text: Sullivan was twice the Scarer you will ever be! : Randall glares at Waternoose.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Boo. Waternoose looks as if he’s seen a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Sullivan? With a massive effort, Sullivan wrenches the machine from moorings and throws it towards Randall, Waternoose and Fungus. It pins them to the wall. Sullivan frees Boo from the chair. Waternoose turns to Randall, who has managed to escape.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop him! Randall CAMOUFLAGES, disappearing. Sullivan picks Boo out of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Let’s get you home. Sullivan picks up Boo’s DOOR CARD KEY and runs towards th exit. Suddenly Sulley is knocked back into the room, as if punc by nothing.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pinish him off! Sullivan keeps getting punched. He can’t see where it’s coming from. Behind him, a scream can rises into the air and HITS him the head. Sulley falls to the ground, still holding Boo. Randall materializes, hanging from the ceiling.  or 92.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You don't know how long I've wanted to do that, Sullivan! Sullivan swings at Randall and misses. Using his tail as a whip, Randall sends Sulley flying out into the hallway. Sullivan lands with a THUD. Boo spills out of his arms. S quickly hides in a crevice in the hallway. Sullivan is hit in the face with a snowball. He turns to see...

dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look, it's not that I don't care about the kid.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Mike, you don't understand-- Mid-sentence, Sulley is ATTACKED by an invisible Randall. Mike continues his apology, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes I do, I was just mad, that’s all! I needed some time to think. But you shouldn't have left me out there! Sullivan is SLAMMED against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (winded) I'm being attacked!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No, I'm not attacking you! I'm trying to be honest! Just hear me out! Look, you and I are a team. Nothing is more important than our friendship. Boo tugs on Mike’s arm, and points at the invisible Randa

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know, kid, he's too sensitive. Invisible Randall chokes Sullivan, who gasps for air.  (r.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on pal, if you start crying, I'm gonna cry, and I'll never get through this. Sullivan grabs futilely at his neck.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I wasn't there for you... but I am now. Sulley is about to black out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: {annoyed) Hey, Sulley, I am bearing my soul here! The least you could do is pay attention! Mike hurls his snowball towards Sullivan, but instead it smashes into Randall's invisible face, EXPOSING him to vi Sullivan punches Randall, knocking him out. Randall collapses to the ground, becoming visible again. Sullivan gasps for breath.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, look at that! It‘s Randall! {putting it all together) Ohhbhhh. Sullivan picks up Boo and Mike and runs out.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Come on! Randall is beginning to come to. Waternoose yells at him from behind the machine.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Get up! There can’t be any witnesses! Randall lifts himself off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: There won't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan runs down the hallway, carrying both Boo and Mik

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I'm glad you camé back, Mike.  r)

dialogues.text: Hey, somebody has to take care of you, you big hairball. A horrible SCREAM gets Mike’s attention. It’s Celia! Snak flowing wildly, she LEAPS through the air and tackles him the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shmoopsie Poo! I really can’t talk...

dialogues.text: Come on! Sulley drags Mike away. Celia isn’t about to-be left behind again. She holds onto Mike, and so is dragged after him.

dialogues.text: Michael, if you don’t tell me what’s going on right now, we are through. Do you hear me? Through!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (being pulled from both sides) Okay, here’s the truth! You know the kid that they’re looking for? Sulley let her in! We tried to send her back, but Waternoose has a secret plot and now Randall’s right behind us and he’s trying to kill us!

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: You expect me to believe that pack of lies, Mike Wazowski?! Boo pops up from behind Sullivan’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BOO
dialogues.text: Mike Wazowski! Celia SHRIEKS in surprise. She lets go of Mike as he and Sulley round the corner towards the Scare Floor.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Will you move it! Look out, you idiot! Celia’s eye widens, then narrows in determination.

dialogues.text: Sullivan and Mike run onto the crowded Scare Floor and he for an empty station.

dialogues.text: Sorry! They swipe BOO’S CARD KEY and wait anxiously for her door arrive.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL

dialogues.speaker: CELIA, (OVER P.A.)

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE WALLA
dialogues.text: Way to go, Randall! Nice job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celia hangs up an intercom phone with a smile. Success!

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: Go get ‘em, Googley Bear.

dialogues.text: Sulley and Mike watch as Fungus and Randall struggle to b free of the crowd. Boo SQUEALS happily as her door enters the Scare Floor on conveyor belt above.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (pointing) There it is! Meanwhile Fungus is being tossed happily into the air by celebratory group.

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: Whoa! Ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Get off my tail! Let me through! Randall is finally able to push his way through the mob. heads towards Sullivan. Boo’s door will not reach their station before Randall. Sullivan punches a RED PANIC BUTTON on the keypad. An ALARM SOUNDS and Boo’s door, poised high above the station, HEADS BACK into the door vault. Sullivan runs toward in the next station over. All the do are being returned to the vault.

dialogues.text: Sulley, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Grab on, Mike! With Boo in one hand, Sulley grabs the door as.it sails o of its station. Mike manages to grab onto Sulley’s tail.

dialogues.text: Are you out of your miiiiind? Randall watches the trio cling to the door hanging overhe He climbs aboard a door being ejected and sails up onto t track several doors behind Sulley, Mike, and Boo. The two dozen doors glide towards the vault.  (. 97.

dialogues.text: Sullivan, Mike and Boo follow Boo’s door down a long corridor.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sulley, what are we doing?!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: We have to get Boo’s door and find a station!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Make her Laugh}

dialogues.text: Gimme that kid! (hitting the door) _Ooof!

dialogues.text: Whoa! Doors are stacked in rows above and below them, like a wa

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I hope that hurt, lizard boy! Mike jumps over to a door with Sullivan and Boo. The thre vide off across the vault.

dialogues.text: Great job buddy, we lost him! Suddenly Boo slips through Sulley's arms and disappears. SCREAMS.  Fa Cf 102. Randall APPEARS atop the door, holding Boo in his many ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pile of partially assembled doors starts to MOVE, as if someone were stacked within it. The top door POPS OPEN and Sullivan jumps out, followed b Mike. They run.to the edge of the platform.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Boo!  (eh 103. Sullivan spots a little purple figure riding a door off i the distance.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There they are! He runs to the end of the platform which sticks out precariously over a sea of moving doors like the prow of ship. Sullivan climbs up and balances on its metal railin

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sulley, what are you doing? Sulley! Timing it just right, Sullivan LEAPS out onto a passing d Mike follows, jumping onto the door behind him. Their doors join up with the “freeway” of doors above, speeding ahead.

dialogues.text: Looks like we caught the express, pal! Sullivan desperately scans the doors ahead.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Do you see them?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Straight ahead! Sure enough, Randall is heading towards the exit with Boo tow. Sullivan JUMPS onto a faster moving door on an adjacent track. He jumps a second time but loses his grip, almost FALLING The door tilts toward another track, BANGING into oncomin doors as they zip by.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Whoa! Aaah! Randall hears the commotion and turns around. He spots Sullivan, regaining his balance and closing in. Randall opens the door he’s riding on and slithers into t room. Sullivan uses his door like a pendulum to swing forward into the room after him.
INT. MISC. KID’S ROOM Sullivan bursts through the door and spots Boo standing a in the middle of the moonlit room.

dialogues.speaker: BOO
dialogues.text: Kitty!

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (relieved) Boo! _ Randall SWINGS down from the rafters, KICKS Sullivan, and sends him tumbling backward out of the open door. Sulley just barely gets a hand-hold on the lip of the doo SULLIVAN (CONT’D) Aah! Aaah!

dialogues.text: Randall stands menacingly over Sulley, who holds onto the bottom of the door for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: Look at everybody's favorite scarer now! You stupid, pathetic waste! Randall STOMPS on one of Sullivan’s hands, knocking it of the door edge. Sulley dangles by one arm as the door spee through the vault. INT. MISC. KID’S ROOM Boo cowers at the back of the room, afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randall steps on Sullivan's other hand. Sulley hangs on w just two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: You’ve been number one for too long, Sullivan. Now your time is up! INT. MISC. KID’S ROOM Seeing her kitty in danger, BOO’S FACE CHANGES from fear anger.  sc

dialogues.text: Randall prepares to push Sully off once and for all.

dialogues.speaker: RANDALL
dialogues.text: And don’t worry... I'll take good care of the kid!

dialogues.text: {in pain) Yaaaaah! Boo is RIDING Randall, pulling his fronds! Each painful j of his fronds makes Randall change colors. Sullivan lifts himself back up into the room. Clinging to Randall like a bucking bronco, Boo grabs a ba and WALLOPS Randall repeatedly on the head. With each hit CHANGES .COLORS and patterns. RANDALL (CONT’D) Ow! Yowch! Aah! Sullivan grabs Randall by the neck, wrestling him like an alligator. Randall writhes and wiggles, but Sulley is abl to subdue him. Boo ROARS at Randall.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (to Randall) She’s not scared of you anymore. Boo ROARS again.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Mike places a door near the edge of the platform, opens i and crouches down in front like a baseball catcher.  (h, 106..

dialogues.text: No, no, wait, please don‘t- Sulley pitches Randall through. RANDALL (cont’d) Ahhhhhhhh !

dialogues.text: Pthpththth!

dialogues.text: Okay, Boo it’s time to go home! Take care of yourself and be a good girl, okay? Mike opens Boo's door, but sees only other doors stacked behind it.

dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.text: The power’s out! Make her laugh again!

dialogues.text: All right, I’ve got a move here that’1l bring down the house. Mike jumps gracefully into the air and does a flip, landi crotch first on top of the metal door track.

dialogues.text: (in pain) Hehh? Sullivan notices that Boo’s hood is down.

dialogues.text: (sing-songy) Uncle Mike, try not to yell in front of her, you know we still need her to laugh!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Funny, right... huh? (annoyed) These are the jokes, kid. Boo’s door jerks violently and heads off towards the exit Mike, Sulley and Boo hang onto the door as it moves.- MIKE (CONT’D) Whoaaa! What’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Hold on!

dialogues.text: Waternoose stands at an EMPTY DOOR STATION with Boo’s car key in his claw. He addresses a group of CDA agents.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: When the door lands in the station, cut the power. You'll have the child, and the criminals responsible for this whole mess. Boo's door sails out of the vault corridor and into the S Floor. Sullivan, Mike and Boo peek out from behind the do and see Waternoose and the CDA agents below.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (stage whisper) Great. A welcoming committee. What are we gonna do? Sullivan has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a
The door lands in the station. The power shuts off.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: ‘This is the CDA. Come out slowly with the child in plain sight. . Mike emerges from behind the door, carrying Boo.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, you got us. Here we are, here‘s the kid. I'm cooperating. But before you take us away, I have one thing to say. Mike sticks his tongue out. There's a sock on it!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: {throwing sock) Catch! It lands on an agent in the middle of the pack! The frenzied CDA agents pounce on the agent with the sock

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENTS
dialogues.text: Twenty-three-nineteen! We have a toxic projectile! Isolate the contaminate! Mike takes off, carrying Boo. The CDA agents see this and chase after them.

dialogues.text: After the suspect!

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Secure the area! Bring in reinforcements! Waternoose takes up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Stop him! As the commotion clears, Sullivan peeks out from behind B door. Boo is with him, now out of her disguise and wearin only one sock. Sullivan pops her door out of its station and heads for t exit.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Come on! Waternoose hurries after the CDA agents.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: (re: Mike and Boo) Don‘t let them get away! CLANG! Waternoose spins around to see Sullivan, who has knocked over a stack of cans during his escape. Sulley scoops up Boo and her door and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calling to CDA) Wait, wait, come back, come back! He has the child! It’s no use, the agents have already disappeared after Mi Something SNAPS. Waternoose lunges after Sullivan like a wild animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan races down the hall, with Boo in one arm, and he door in the other. Waternoose clambers after them, closin in.

dialogues.speaker: . WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Sullivan! Sullivan! Give me the child!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan bursts through the door of the Simulator Room, Waternoose close behind. Sulley breaks a PIPE off the wall and slides it through t door handles just as Waternoose SLAMS against the door. Sulley bends the pipe around the handles to secure it. He frantically removes the door currently in the station.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: (slamming against door) Open this door! Open this door! Sulley replaces the simulator door with Boo’s door.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sullivan! Don’t do it! Sullivan pushes a button on the door station keypad, pick Boo up and runs inside.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Come on.  a 111. Sullivan looks back at Waternoose.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: (screaming) Don’t go in that room! Sullivan closes the closet door behind him. Waternoose YE and beats against the Tryout Room door. INT. BOO’S ROOM Sullivan stands over the bed, tucking in the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I think we stopped him, Boo. You’re safe now. You be a good girl, okay? SLAM! Sulley turns to see Waternoose standing in the room closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: This has gone far enough, James. Sullivan stands protectively in front of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: She’s home now. Just leave her alone!

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: I can’t do that! She’s seen too much. You both have.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: It doesn’t have to be this way!

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: I have no choice! Times have changed. Scaring isn’t enough anymore! Waternoose closes in on Sullivan, raising up on his crab intimidatingly.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: But kidnapping children?

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: I’11 kidnap a thousand children before I let this company die! And I’1l1 silence anyone who gets in my way! Waternoose smacks Sullivan, sending him flying to the flo  112.

dialogues.speaker: NL SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: No! Waternoose grabs Boo from the bed!

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATRONIC KID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Night, Mom! ‘Night, Mom! ‘Night, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: What? Waternoose blinks, uncomprehending. The child isn’t Boo a all, but the Animatronic Kid from the simulator. The wall of the bedroom begins to rise.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Simulation terminated. Simulation terminated.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: Wha. .?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ~ Behind the fourth wall of the SIMULATOR, the TRYOUT ROO Nw filled with. yellow-suited CDA agents. Mike sits in th evaluator’s chair.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (to CDA agents) Well, I don’t know about the rest of you guys, but I spotted several big mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: But... but, how did... how...?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know what? Let's watch my favorite part again, shall we? Mike rewinds the tape and plays it.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (ON TAPE)
dialogues.text: I‘1l kidnap a thousand children before TI let this company die! Mike plays it back again, for emphasis. WATERNOOSE (ON TAPE) (cont'd) I’11 kidnap a thousand children before I let this company die!  Ch 113. Waternoose sees himself on the monitor. WATERNOOSE (cont'd) Wha... Wha...? The CDA agents discuss the situation. Boo peeks out from under the bed. Sullivan motions for he to stay quiet. She nods and crawls back. CDA agents walk onto the stage and grab Waternoose.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Alright, come with us.

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE
dialogues.text: W-what are you doing?! Take your hands off me! You can’t arrest me! ‘The CDA agents lead Waternoose out of the simulator room

dialogues.speaker: WATERNOOSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hope you‘re happy, Sullivan! You’ve destroyed this company! Monsters Incorporated is dead! Where will everyone get their scream now?! The energy crisis will only get worse! Because of YOU!!} Sullivan is clearly troubled by Waternoose’s words.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Stay where you are. Number One wants to talk to you. (to other CDA) Attention! Sullivan and Mike exchange a confused look: A PARADE OF AGENTS enter the room, standing at attention. the last two enter, they make room for...

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: Hello boys. Sullivan and Mike’s mouths drop open.

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: Two and a half years of undercover work were almost wasted when you intercepted that child, Mr. Sullivan. Of course, without your help, I never would have known that this went all the way up to Waternoose. Boo scampers up to Sullivan. Nearby CDA agents nervously step away.

dialogues.speaker: ROZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, about the girl... Sullivan scoops Boo up in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: I just want to send her home.

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: Very good. (into wrist communicator) Bring me a door shredder.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: What? You mean I can’t see her again?

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: That's the way it has to be. I‘11 give you five minutes. Sulley looks at Boo and sighs. Boo seems to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulley activates Boo’s door. The light illuminates. Mike taps Boo lightIy on the shoulder. He holds out his hand, formally.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well, so long, kid.

dialogues.speaker: BOO
dialogues.text: Mike Wazowski! Boo gives Mike a big hug. He tenses, then relaxes and hug her back.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh, Boo. It’s been fun. Boo waves bye-bye to Mike as she turns back to Sulley.  c)

MIKE (CONT’D) Go ahead... go grow up. Sullivan smiles down at Boo. Ready. . Sulley opens her door. Boo SQUEALS with delight. INT. BOO’S ROOM Boo runs into the room, happy to be home. She PULLS SULLI into her room and hands him VARIOUS TOYS, each one with a sense of excitement.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Uh... Boo... um... (accepting a toy) Oh, look at that. Yeah, you know-- (another toy) Oh, that’s cute. Yeah... uh... Boo... Boo hands him a teddy bear. SULLIVAN (cont’d) Well, that’s very nice. Sulley realizes its up to him to say goodbye. He grabs he playfully and flies her like an airplane to her bed.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here, you! Boo GIGGLES wildly as Sullivan deposits hér in bed. He tu the teddy bear in next to her.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (singing) Oh, he’s a happy bear... Boo looks to her closet and points.

dialogues.speaker: BOO
dialogues.text: Dars byargs lub.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Nothing’s coming out of the closet to scare you anymore. Right? Boo smiles and gives a little nod. Sullivan tickles her c

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Boo.  i, Ck, 116.

dialogues.speaker: BOO
dialogues.text: Kitty?

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Kitty has to go. Boo gives Sulley a big hug. Sullivan sets her back in bed, then walks slowly to the d He looks back at her one last time. Boo looks at him sadly from her bed. Sulley turns away, slowly closing the closet door after h Boo jumps out of bed. She runs to her closet and opens it

dialogues.speaker: BOO
dialogues.text: Boo! The door opens, revealing clothes, boxes. and toys.

dialogues.speaker: BOO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kitty? The portal to the monster world has closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo’s door is shredded.

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: None of this ever happened, gentlemen. And I don’t want to see any paperwork on this. Roz and the CDA agents exit. Sullivan and Mike share a silent moment. Mike notices a single piece of Boo’s door on the floor. He hands it to Sullivan. Sullivan clasps the small chip in his large hand.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MI FACTORY, DAY
dialogues.text: CDA agents shut Waternoose into the back of their van and drive away. : A large CROWD OF MI EMPLOYEES murmur with concern about w will happen now.  on 117.

dialogues.speaker: SMITTY
dialogues.text: I bet we get the rest of the day off!

dialogues.speaker: NEEDLEMAN
dialogues.text: You idiot! They’re gonna shut down the factory! Several monsters GASP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sullivan and Mike walk out into the evening light.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m telling you pal, when that wall went up, you should have seen the look on Waternoose’s face. Woo hoo! I hope we get a copy of that tape! Mike looks up at Sullivan. His buddy looks pretty sad. MIKE (CONT’D) Hey, you alright? Come on pal, cheer up! We did it! We got Boo home! Sure, we put the factory in the toilet... and hundreds of people‘’11l be out of work now... not to mention the angry mob that'll come after us when there’s no more power. But hey, at least we had some laughs, right? As Mike continues walking, Sullivan slowly comes. to a st an idea forming in his mind.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Laughs... INT. CHILD’S BEDROOM A kid sleeps in bed. Soft moonlight illuminates the room. A shadow cuts across the bedsheets. The silhouette of a large horned creature rises up over the bed. The kid sees the monster and GASPS. Suddenly, the WHINE of MICROPHONE FEEDBACK fills the room

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, is this thing on? Hello. Hello. Testing, testing...  rc ‘oo 118. The kid turns on a light, revealing Mike, sitting on a st microphone in hand.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, good evening, how are ya? Nice to see ya. I tell you it’s great to be here in... your room. Where are you from? The kid stares at Mike, confused.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Never mind. You’re in kindergarten, right? I loved kindergarten. Best three years of my life! No response. Is that supposed to be funny? MIKE (cont’d) (forging on) But I loved sports! Dodge ball was the best. I was the fastest one out there. Of course, I was the ball... The kid looks on, sceptically. That was worse than the la joke. Mike knows he’s dying. MIKE (cont’d) Alright . Mike stands up, tosses the microphone in his mouth and SWALLOWS IT. Amplified STOMACH GURGLES are heard while he waits. He finally lets out a HUGE BURP, projecting the microphone out of his mouth and catching it. MIKE (CONT’D) (what do you think?) Huh? The kid begins HOWLS with laughter. Mike grabs his stool heads for the closet door. :

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, thanks a lot! 1/11 be here all week. Remember to tip your waitresses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scare Floor has now officially become The Laugh Floor Mike smiles as A GIGANTIC CAN FILLS WITH LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Great job, Mikey! You filled your quota on the first kid of the day!  fk 119.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Not bad huh? You know, only somebody - with perfect comedic timing could produce this much energy in one shot.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Uh huh. And the fact that laughter is ten times more powerful than scream had nothing to do with it. Mike clears his throat, sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: CELIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, Googley Bear! Come here, you! Celia calls to Mike from a nearby desk. Mike tosses the microphone and runs to her.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Schmoopsie poo! Celia and Mike kiss. Celia’s snakes begin kissing Mike to

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: (scolding snakes) Girls, girls! Ple- stop, stop, stop. (coyly)- Michael, you’re such a charmer.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, did you bring the magazine?

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: They just delivered a whole box!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Let me see it! Sulley and I made the cover right? He opens the box and we see: “BUSINESS SHRIEK” magazine. The lead article, “MONSTERS, INC. BACK ON TOP!” shows Sullivan in full view. Mike's fa is totally obscured by the bar code.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: {in shock) I don’t believe it...

dialogues.speaker: CELIA
dialogues.text: (sympathetic) Googley Bear...  (t 120. Mike lifts up a copy of the magazine and holds it in fron him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m on the cover of a magazine! YOW!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A monster inserts CHATTERING TEETH into his mouth as he w into a closet door. Fungus puts on a pair of THREE~EYED GROUCHO GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: FUNGUS
dialogues.text: Oh, this is great! George walks by carrying a watermelon and a mallet. Thaddeus Bile backs out. of a door, JACKS sticking from h butt. Laughter emanates from the kid’s room, filing the tank. Satisfied, Bile bounces a soccer ball and smiles. Sullivan makes his way to the end of the hall. He surveys the fruit of his labors. LAUGHTER emanates from all the doors. Workers happily mov giant scream cans, tell each other jokes, juggle, and enj themselves. A GRAPH on Sullivan’s clipboard shows FIRST YEAR PROFITS going through the roof. But Sulley’s smile. fades. Taped to the clipboard backing the now tattered PICTURE Boo drew of herself and Sulley. Below is the WOODEN CHIP from her door.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Sulley! Sullivan covers the picture as Mike approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Mike... I was uh...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Listen, if you got a minute, there’s something I want to show you. Okay? Close your eyes, follow me.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (hesitating)

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Come on... no peeking! Sullivan follows Mike with a SIGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike backs into the room, leading Sullivan along.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Come on, keep coming, keep coming...

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: (eyes closed) Mike...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (chiding) Come on... and follow the sultry sound of my voice. Okay... stop! Open ‘em. Sulley opens his eyes. Before him sits BOO’S RECONSTRUCTE DOOR, meticulously glued back together. MIKE (CONT’D) Ta da! Sullivan stops, scarcely able to believe what he’s seeing

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Mike? Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sorry it took so long pal. There was a lot of wood to go through. Mike’s hands are covered with SPLINTERS and BAND~AIDS. MIKE (CONT’D) You know, it only works if you have every piece. The door is clearly missing a piece. Sullivan looks down his clip board where the sliver of Boo’s door is taped. Sullivan fits the piece into the door. It fits perfectly. The red light above the door glows. Mike smiles and steps aside. Sullivan reaches for the door-knob.  122. INT. BOO’S ROOM, DAY The door opens. Sullivan’s nervous face is hit with light he scans the room.

dialogues.speaker: SULLIVAN
dialogues.text: Boo?

dialogues.speaker: BOO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Kitty! Sullivan smiles. FADE OUT.
